channel.title: Getting Server Online
channel.description:
Can someone help me set my server up? I'm at my wits end.
Okay, I have never hosted a server because it seems I can never get my server online. I've tried many times over the years of getting a server online and each time I can never get my friends to be able to connect to the server. I don't know what I am doing wrong and I am not an idiot. I feel I may be over looking something or comprehending something wrong. I understand how everything works now and I felt that I would be able to set it up. I used No-IP to set up a static ip and my server won't connect to it. I am just frustrated because kids that are 12 years old that don't even know what an OS is can set up a server and follow a simple tutorial, yet I can't. I have TeamViewer if anyone wants to help me through that. It is just really starting to piss me off...

item.title: Getting Server Online
item.dc:creator: @baddy351 baddy351
item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

just trying to help man.
So yeah whatever u portforward, the ip set for that has to be differ e turns ur default gateway

Read full topic

item.title: Getting Server Online
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

baddy351:

U using duc 2? Also are u really portforwarded? Make sure. To do that go to canyouseeme.org, if the port is open ur good to go. Tell me is it says yes

You may have helped me fixed it. I had to change in my router from the ip to connect to 192.168.1.2 to my IPv4 192.168.1.134 It works now. Knew it was something stupid… If this works I will <3 you.

Read full topic

@the_wanderer wrote:

Yes and yes. I already did that.

item.title: Getting Server Online
item.dc:creator: @baddy351 baddy351
item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

Ok, make sure for 1 the duc is up, and the box near the ip is checked. ( I suggest using duc 2.2.1, not 3.) try this stuff, if that doesnt work, then tell me

Read full topic

item.title: Getting Server Online
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

baddy351:

Ok, u may be overlooking random stuff. For instance, what router do you have? Does the router have the latest firmware? Are ur enviormental variables set? Also try the autoportforwarder in the server downloads section. Hope i helped. I know how u feel, trust me.

I have a linksys E200.
Not sure about the router having the latest firmware.
Environmental variables are just so you can compile and code correctly. This is when you get the error "unable to find command ‘javac’ " and such. If I’m wrong then I’ll be surprised.
If you noticed, at the moment I am not having issues with portforwarding. On my own computer that I am hosting the server on, it will not connect with the static IP that I set up through No-IP. Says, “Error connecting to server.”

Read full topic
